1511551884_1PqPgJRxQNDQcWu57czCohVq92DkN.body: LOL..Try hiding in a car and drive to Hong Kong. The land borders are not that strict.

1513170471_1PyrAjbZiHyfW7jSWeUpDPSeMU7sA.body: p2p is inherently not suitable for tasks such as translation.  If I can remember correctly, it took terabytes of data to train google translate to its accuracy today (actual size could be wrong, bottom line is that our casual home PCs won't be able to handle that much of data). The best solution here is to use translation apis within zites.

1525405825_1Jt6aamh4UWpSRG421JivqanL5SQc.body: The Chinese government definitely knows about Zeronet. Not long ago they began to block Zeronet's default port (I think its 15441), and even earlier they blocked the zeronet.io website. IPFS got a similar treatment, and I believe that its restrictions on zeronet is more of a preventive procedure than an act out of fear. Zeronet never had a big impact in China.  Those who still use it and regularly visit the Chinese forum are mostly spammers, conspiracy believers, and followers of the Fa Lun Gong cult.
